lines.content: I used OpenAI's Codex to automatically generate ParserTest.java. I believe that it did an excellent job following the project's coding conventions and generating JUnit test cases to cover all possible parsing scenarios. The only slight issue that I encountered was the JUnit test cases originally didn't check if the fields within each command was parsed correctly. However, I believe this was partly my fault as well, as I originally did not override the `toString()` method for each Command subclass (and all fields were declared `private`). After I added this method for each Command subclass, I told Codex to update all JUnit test cases to be more comprehensive by checking that all fields were parsed correctly, and Codex did this flawlessly. It even automatically ran `checkStyle`, and wrapped line breaks.
